title: Blackscreen Launcher, I found a fix!!!!
body:
Hey guys I've had this problem for around 5-6 weeks now and after experimenting with some settings today I've solved the issue for myself I can only hope it works for you guys too
(i have win 8). I figured out the problem and it was a proxy that steam, Uplay and league couldn't run through. i had to disable the proxy and it started working again. 
hope this works:
1) Go to Start and type proxy 
2)Click on the program that pops up on the top of the startmenu. (should be something like "Proxy network settings")
3) Go to LAN-Settings / Proxy settings
4) unclick the top box in the Proxyserver section. (normally says "Use a proxy?"

replies.body: i don't have a proxy set up the settings are set to system default which is automatic detection but my patcher / launcher is fine its my main menu after you login thats the problem for me these are the pictures of what i see there are 3 different ways it looks but i cant upload more than 1 per post the main 1 is the infinite loading screen
here are the other pictures this one is the tiles load but no images show up
then there is the tiles load and some images load and others cannot be loaded  any idea what could cause this?
Go into your Internet Options (from Control Panel if on Windows) and reset everything to their defaults. Then, go to "Security" and set it to "Medium-Low" for the internet.
Thanks for your help i have set the slider to medium and all the tiles loaded up instantly thank you very much
the infinite loading is back and fix dosent work anymore any other ideas?

*Do it again*/or just make sure nothing's changed the setting back to High or Medium-High.

>Windows not being a dirty little slut and letting you lower its security.
the only way i can set the security lower than medium is to set custom settings

i have set everything to allow in custom settings and it worked
i am now going to go through and reset settings back to default and see what ones are blocking LoL
it seems some things in the ActiveX are disabled by default i set them to prompt and it seems to be working now
sometimes all it takes is to walk away from a problem and come back to it later and you just fix it outright

>sometimes all it takes is to walk away from a problem and come back to it later and you just fix it outright

That rings true. Also, it's possible to edit comments by clicking "Edit".

So, is your menu working correctly now?
it still takes 2-3 reloads to get it to load completely i have no idea what could be blocking it

Well, that's better than nothing, but still suboptimal.

Have you tried contacting your ISP and seeing if there's any possible failure?

i have and they say everything is normal on there end but as of today it wont load no matter how many time i reload it and all of the steps that normally fix it no longer work i have also put my DNS to a top level root dns server closest to me and that fixed it for about a day then stopped working
i have reset the settings back to default but i only have 3 options available high, medium-high and medium im using 8.1 pro

But the funny thing is that a person has to go through the exact same process in order to start using the proxy. If you're the person that did this, then attempting to connect without use of the proxy should be something you try naturally when something doesn't work (100% reliance on your own server is just asking for trouble). If you *aren't* the person who did it, then you're under-mining the person who did it for you, which could have even worse unforeseen consequences (extreme example, but if your normal connection is being monitored, then connecting without a proxy puts you at risk). You're better off just asking the person who did it for you to try it without the proxy.
